body_html:
I think a float is better for interpolation. A type of integer can't have decimals. Was the first parameter of the constant return method a float? It could have parsed the 1 only as a 1.0. Where you passed the 1.0, it would have allowed the while loop actually to have the option to go through 1.1, 1.2, 1.3, etc. (even 1.111511...), where an integer of 1 would just return a fixed 1.0. I am not even sure even if the 1 (int) in your first example even cast or convert as floats. Their API shows an example of using -1.0 a float. https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/constant.

Not sure if this helped.

body:
I think a float is better for interpolation. A type of integer can't have decimals. Was the first parameter of the constant return method a float? It could have parsed the 1 only as a 1.0. Where you passed the 1.0, it would have allowed the while loop actually to have the option to go through 1.1, 1.2, 1.3, etc. (even 1.111511...), where an integer of 1 would just return a fixed 1.0. I am not even sure even if the 1 (int) in your first example even cast or convert as floats. Their API shows an example of using -1.0 a float. https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/constant. 

Not sure if this helped.
